Description: Egyptian terracotta figure of male cult member in ‘grotesque’ style. Head only. Bald and consistent with representations of priests or followers of Ptah or Harpocrates. Mould-made and solid with plain back. Red-brown Nile silt fabric.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Probably made in Naukratis. Parallels from Naukratis (Cambridge NA697, NA701; Boston MFA 86.453; 88.887) and an unprovenanced piece, dated to the 1st century BC (Dresden, Fischer 1994, Pl. 45, no.456). Fischer, J. 1994. ‘Griechisch- römische Terrakotten aus Ägypten. Die Sammlungen Sieglin und Schreiber. Dresden, Leipzig, Stuttgart, Tübingen’. Tübingen: Wasmuth.
Bibliographic references: Gutch 1898/1899 / Excavations at Naukratis, D. The Terracottas (p. 95, no. 262)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DD.523) (Phase 3)
